column5: Great report......looks like a great time w/ your father!  dk

Beer? Anytime bud! I can relate to a couple of things in your post. First, 2 seasons back my dad was working by himself up at my camp, and similar to your dad, had an unfortunate accident with a table saw. In his case he actually managed to sever 4 fingers on his left hand! After cleaning up his mess, putting the tools away and locking everything (  he's nuts!), he drove the boats 20 mins. back to the landing, hopped in the truck and drove himslf 40 mins to the hospital in Kirkland Lake. Within 1/2 hour they had him on a plane to St. Jo's in Hamilton where a plastic surgeon actually managed to re-attach his fingers. He's a tough old bugger, and very, very lucky. Can also relate to the dragonflies. At the marina at my lake we have a similar hatch every year at this time. Funny thing though, I was up there working this past weekend and drove to the landing Friday evening to load some stuff into the truck. Unknown to me, everything I loaded in the truck had tons of dragonfly nymphs clinging to it. Anyhow, yesterday morning I hopped in the truck to go home and 5 mins down the hwy almost drove the truck into a ditch. Apparantly the nymphs had hatched into dragonflies between Fri and Sunday morning....I had 30 of them freaking out and buzzing all around the inside of my truck  . It was actually pretty comical...
A ver cool fishing/camping .  ..report,and great pics too,sounds like everyone had a blast catching all those fish,the scenery looks amazing thanks for sharing.....cheers
Congrats on a awesome trip with your Dad....nice fish and beautiful scenery up that way.  Jason
Excellent, thanks for sharing...Looks like an awesome time.

Great post...and times with Dad are the greatest. My Dad and I will be taking our 2nd fly-in trip in July and those times are very near and dear to my heart....times that will never be forgotten! I need a kleenex.....
Time to be cherished indeed! This will be an annual trip, until the time when one of us is unable to make it.  (we won't think or talk about that now though)
awesome report, something you and your dad will always remember

Great read!  Thank you for sharing your fishing trip....looks like paradise!  I always enjoy the scenery shots, I commit them to memory so I can see those while I am fishing vs the usual graffiti buildings rusty rail cars etc.  Hope your dad's hand heals fast!!  Thanks again.....really enjoyed it!   bly

Amazing report !  Thanks for sharing, sure looks like one fantastic adventure! Have your Dad take care of his hand! Unless it is easier just to reel all those fish in and have someone else do all the grunt work or him. Sure looks like it worked on this trip. Congrats!  Easton
Hey, great report bud! Really glad I could be of help to you, and happy your trip was a little better this year!
sounds like a great trip and lake to fish  hiway 144 and 560 is about 458 km from Orillia   100 more km and you are there......so it's not that far from the area I like to fish
Another Excellant report on OFC!!!! I foind that dragon fly hatch and all those dragon flies interesting. I've noticed there are have been more insects in general out on the lakes this year also.
The pictures of the dragonflies don't do them justice Johnny.   They were literally swarming....EVERYWHERE! I will never forget them - that's for sure.       Mike, lemme buy you a beer sometime.
